thread.title: "I should have protected her" Becky Watts' father tells of turmoil on second anniversary of teenager's senseless murder - Mirror Online
thread.title_full: "I should have protected her" Becky Watts' father tells of turmoil on second anniversary of teenager's senseless murder - Mirror Online

author: Geoff Bennett
title: "I should have protected her" Becky Watts' father tells of turmoil on second anniversary of teenager's senseless murder - Mirror Online
text:
News "I should have protected her" Becky Watts' father tells of turmoil on second anniversary of teenager's senseless murder Today marks the two year anniversary of the pretty Bristol teenager's death - killed at the hands of her step-brother Nathan Matthews and his girlfriend Shauna Hoare Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
The father of murdered teenager Becky Watts admits he still torments himself that he didn't do more to protect his beloved daughter from her killers. 
Today marks the two year anniversary of the pretty Bristol teenager's death - killed at the hands of her stepbrother Nathan Matthews and his girlfriend Shauna Hoare. 
But Becky's dad Darren Galsworthy - who is married to Matthews' mother Anjie - says this is a date which he 'doesn't want to mark'. 
Speaking exclusively to The Bristol Post he said: "On this day Becky fought her battle for her life and lost. 
"The thought of this day destroys me. 
"As a father I feel I should have been there to protect her. 
"But I went to work to provide for my family. 
"I am on a lot of tablets now and I'm not sure how I'm going to get through it." Becky Watts' father Darren Galsworthy pictured during the trial (Photo: Daily Mirror) Becky Watts died two years ago today (Photo: PA) 
It was on a cold February day two years ago that 16-year-old Becky went missing from the home which she shared with her dad and his wife Anjie. 
The biggest missing person enquiry Bristol has ever seen was launched - and the city united in its search for the teenager who vanished off the face of the planet. 
Then, some 11 days later, her dismembered body was discovered in suitcases and bags stashed in a shed near the home of her step-brother Nathan Matthews and his girlfriend Shauna Hoare. 
Matthews was convicted of her murder in November 2015 - and sentenced to life imprisonment with a minimum of 33 years. Becky Watts' half-brother Nathan Matthews was convicted of her murder (Photo: PA) Read More Becky Watts' stepbrother killer Nathan Matthews 'burned with boiling butter in prison' 
Hoare meanwhile was found guilty of manslaughter and sentenced to 17 years in prison. 
Both were also convicted of conspiracy to kidnap Watts, preventing a lawful burial by dismembering and hiding her body, perverting the course of justice, and possession of two stun guns. 
Darren previously told the Bristol Post: "I am a husk of a man, there is nothing left for me. Shauna Hoare was convicted of manslaughter (Photo: PA) Read More 
"This has completely destroyed the family. Those two have left us with nothing, absolutely nothing. 
"They took everything from us and I am still angry about what happened. 
"We are just existing from day to day." Like us on Facebook
